alert.note: Alert for Benton; Morgan (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 4:28AM CDT until August 01 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN BENTON AND MORGAN COUNTIES... At 428 AM CDT, Local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Several reports of flooding were reported along Highway B south of Cole Camp. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Versailles, Lincoln, Cole Camp, Stover, Laurie, Sunrise Beach, Barnett, Syracuse, Gravois Mills, Crockerville, Zora, Florence, Lakeview Heights, Mora, Edmonson, Rocky Mount and Lake of The Ozarks. This includes the following low water crossings... Little Gravois Creek at Leatherman Lane, Big Buffalo Creek at Highway WW, Williams Creek at Highway B, Rocky Ford Creek at Ritchey Road, Gabriel Creek at Highway BB, Archer Creek at Highway WW and Richland Creek at Blue Bird Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
